intro: Taralea steyermarkii, commonly known as the Steyermark's taralea, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of silky hairs. Taralea steyermarkii is adapted to cold, arid environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
